FAQ.question: What is the Andhra Pradesh ROR-1B (Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: ROR-1B is an official land record document that contains essential details of an agricultural property, including ownership, cultivation type, liabilities, and land classification.

FAQ.question: Why is the ROR-1B document important?
FAQ.answer: It serves as proof of ownership, helps in crop loans, subsidies, land disputes, and is required for various government and agricultural schemes.

FAQ.question: What details are needed to get the ROR-1B?
FAQ.answer: You must provide the district, mandal, village, survey number, sub-division number (if any), and landowner details.

FAQ.question: How long does it take to obtain the ROR-1B?
FAQ.answer: It is generally available instantly if records exist digitally; otherwise, it may take 1â€“2 working days depending on backend verification.

FAQ.question: What information does the ROR-1B contain?
FAQ.answer: It includes owner name, survey details, land extent, type of cultivation, tenancy details, land classification, and any liabilities or encumbrances on the land.
